timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
Skript.registerEffect(EffOpenBook.class, "(open|show) book %itemtype% to %players%");
Skript.registerEffect(EffOpenBook.class, "(open|show) book %itemtype% (to|for) %players%");

timeline.body: do you need to do the nullable annotations for some reason? we don't really use them in methods

replies.bodyText:
It had a warning
Expression 'book.getSingle(e)' might evaluate to null but is assigned to a variable that is annotated with @NotNull
replies.author: OfficialDonut

timeline.body:
In the event a Bukkit material is changed or what not, an alias should be used here instead, here is an example of another class with books doing it:
https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript/blob/99af0a13a7cefb0e6ed890e775093a51fc3802bf/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/ExprBookTitle.java#L45
https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript/blob/99af0a13a7cefb0e6ed890e775093a51fc3802bf/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/ExprBookTitle.java#L54-L59

in this case you could use the ItemType#equals method instead before getting the item stack.
timeline.bodyHTML:
In the event a Bukkit material is changed or what not, an alias should be used here instead, here is an example of another class with books doing it:

Skript/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/ExprBookTitle.java

Line 45 in 99af0a1

private static final ItemType book = Aliases.javaItemType("book with text");

Skript/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/ExprBookTitle.java

Lines 54 to 59 in 99af0a1

public String convert(ItemType item) {
ItemStack itemStack = item.getRandom();
assert itemStack != null;
if (!book.isOfType(itemStack))
return null;
return ((BookMeta) itemStack.getItemMeta()).getTitle();

in this case you could use the ItemType#equals method instead before getting the item stack.
